title: R Lesson
text:
R: Intro to Remote Sensing
This lesson presents a basic R script for analyzing data.
Launch in Binder Download R Script


# Generate 100 random numbers from normal distribution
x <- rnorm(100)
summary(x)

    Min.  1st Qu.   Median     Mean  3rd Qu.     Max. 
-2.66486 -0.79909 -0.00526  0.03334  0.85453  2.51486 

# Plot histogram
hist(x, main = "Histogram of x", col = "skyblue", border = "white")

title: Simple Data Analysis in R
text:
This notebook demonstrates a basic data analysis in R using randomly generated data. Weâ€™ll compute the summary and plot a histogram.

# Generate 100 random numbers from normal distribution
x <- rnorm(100)
summary(x)


# Plot histogram
hist(x, main = "Histogram of x", col = "skyblue", border = "white")

title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to Remote Sensing Lessons
This site provides interactive tutorials in Python and R using real-world remote sensing data.
Choose a lesson from the navigation bar to get started.

title: Sine function
text:
Run the following code to see the sine function.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.show()

title: Python Lesson
text:
Python: Intro to Remote Sensing
In this lesson, you will run and explore the following Python notebook.
Launch in Binder
Download Notebook

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title("Sine Wave")
plt.show()
